Reviews.Title: The light bleed is unacceptable.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Pantliano "The Photo Guy"
Reviews.Content: The Westinghouse 32" LED LCD TV is affordably priced, but excessive light bleed keeps this from being a good set.Design wise the Westinghouse is very simple and stylish.  It has a dark gray bezel that looks almost like a brushed metal.  On the bottom edge of the set is a clear plastic strip where the power light shines down on the right side.  The base of the set is done in a piano black, but it does not swivel, a disappointment.  At it's thickest point it's about 2" deep.  Overall, it's a nice look, and doesn't look cheap at all.  Indeed, the materials used, and the high quality construction, belie the TV's low price.  I found no dead pixels on the set either.  The included remote is pretty basic, but well assembled and has dedicated buttons for the various inputs.  There is no printed manual included, just one on a CD.Assembling the set is easy.  You simply slide the base onto the bottom and use the two included screws to secure it in place.  It's a job that's easily done by one person as the TV is light and manageable.  Speaking of, the box that the TV comes in is also quite small and easy for one person to carry.  After attaching the base, you just have to plug in the power cord.  The power cord, unfortunately, has a power brick attached to it.Features and connections are very basic.  There is no internet connectivity for the Westinghouse to stream content online, nor is the set 3D capable.  The resolution is 720p, not full HD at 1080p, but for a set of this size, that's hardly objectionable, and you would be hard pressed to notice the difference unless you were really close to the TV.  The connections are as follows; 2 HDMI, 1 Composite, 1 VGA, 1 RF, 1 Digital Audio Out, and 1 Analog Audio Out.When turning on the TV it takes a couple of seconds to respond, which can be disconcerting at first.  The menu system is very easy to navigate, but has very few options, just your basic picture and sound controls and a few odds and ends.  There is no timer to turn the TV on, but there is a sleep timer.  Disappointingly, the picture settings are not input independent.  Also, don't accidentally hit the return button while in the menu system as it will start the set-up wizard and all of your picture settings will be erased.Picture quality is where this set falters, however.  First let's start with the positives.  The colors are rich and vibrant, and detail, especially for HD content, is sharp and crisp.  There is no discernable motion blur and the viewing angle is very wide.  The biggest problem this set has is light bleed.  The edges of the set, when a dark scene is being displayed, are always bright and whitish.  Unfortunately, it's very distracting and ruins any details that are in shadows.  Moreover, the bleeding isn't even uniform, so parts of the screen are worse than others.  When you're watching a bright scene, everything looks great, but as soon as the light levels drop, the Westinghouse reveals its major weakness.  This is definitely not a TV you want to buy if you have a critical eye.  Lastly, there doesn't seem to be a discernable difference between the "warm" and "cool" color temperature picture settings.Sound quality of the Westinghouse is good, and while bass is weak, when the volume is turned up it gets very loud.  There should be no problem hearing the TV in a noisy environment.All in all...a good price, decent features, but disappointing light bleed.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the budget
Reviews.Author: Nuknuk
Reviews.Content: This is a lot of TV for the price.  Flat TVs used to cost a lot of money just a few years ago.  I still remember paying eight hundred dollars for a Vizio that was only a few more inches bigger than this.  Westinghouse is not known for making TVs which may discourage you from purchase.  But the company itself  is an American institution, a technological giant that even built some of the most advanced nuclear facilities around the world.  Flat screens are also made by just a handful of well known makers who sell them to other companies like Westinghouse.We are using this in our master bedroom.  We have an average size room so the size is just perfect.  I have connected it to an AppleTV hooked up through an HDMI cable and audio passing through the TV using an optical cable to a pair of powered speakers.The resolution is only 720P but for a 32-inch screen, you don't see much difference unless you are very particular, in such case you probably looking for a higher priced/ higher end models anyway.  It has a wide angle of viewing that my wife still enjoys watching even doing ironing on the corner of our room.Pros:- great for the budget- wide angle of viewing- lightweight, easy to move aroundCons:- picture quality is OK.- cheaper construction, everything is plastic- You will need to go to westinghousedigital.com website if you want to install an antenna; you have to or you cannot start to scan channels.  You will be required to select the model number and type the serial number.- no tilt, you would need a mount to change the vertical angle.  If you place it on a TV stand, there is no way to move it up or down

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: remy02
Reviews.Content: Purchased product on 11/21/11, loved it, great image, however it died onn 9/14/12.  Today it is 11/2/12 and after calling, emailing or live texting everyday and getting a different answer from customer service from Westinghouse Digital I was told my unit could not be repaired.  I was told it would be 10-12 weeks for a replacement or I could request a refund which would take the same amount of time.  I have read many review, this seems to happen to MANY of the customer who bought the same product.  You get what you pay for, spend the right amount of money for a product that will last and for a manufacturer who will stand behind their product.  I will never be cheap again!

Reviews.Title: My first LED TV
Reviews.Author: Mr. Fantastic
Reviews.Content: This is my first LED tv and I'm impressed.  Great picture, really thin frame.  What more could you ask for?  I've spend a couple days paying attention issues with the picture, really searching for anything.  There really isn't much to complain about.  I was a little concerned about a 60hz refresh rate being an issue, but it's refresh rate, even in action scenes is really, really good.  No complaints there.  The dark is very dark, giving the right feel of depth.  Great picture, the audio is pretty good to.  The audio is not top notch, but perfectly acceptable.  Who really uses the audio directly from a TV anyway?  The menu selection and remote could use a little fine tuning, but noting that would upset a normal person.  I've got this TV in my kitchen and I can't really figure out how to turn it on without the remote.  I haven't tried exhaustively to figure it out, jut saying that it's not intuitive (for me anyway).  Who wouldn't use the remote though?All in all I would highly recommend this to someone looking for a 32inch TV.

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse does not stand by product.
Reviews.Author: scoob
Reviews.Content: Bought a tv on Black Friday from Westinghouse. TV defective. Westinghouse will not stand by warranty. Product is subpar. Customer service ineffective.

Reviews.Title: Activation needed for tuner.
Reviews.Author: Erich Maria Remarque
Reviews.Content: The title refers to a step I had to take when trying to use the cable/antenna tuner. I had to go to Westinghouse's website, type in the TV's serial number and model, receive a PIN, and enter that PIN on the TV. Just thought it was an unnecessary setup step. It's a one time thing however, and you are not required to do it ever again (I think).For the price I think it's decent. I've had it for only a month, so I can't speak about longevity, but I've connected a leaf antenna to it, and I think the picture quality is fine. Definitely a good for casual viewing. You can use it for regular movies, but you might also want to move that couch a little closer since the size isn't that great.It comes with a standard 1366x768 resolution, so it's fine for connecting an HTPC to it and be able to use the Windows desktop when needed.Other than that, I haven't noticed any light bleed like the other reviewer. It's actually perfect as an addon TV for your kitchen or guest room.

Reviews.Title: No support.  If you use a antenna you can't get a tuner code.  don't waste your time and money.
Reviews.Author: S. George
Reviews.Content: Westinghouse support is non-existent.  I just purchased this TV and got it home only to find out that you need a "turner code".  It says that you and text, email or call.  If you want to use a antenna you MUST CALL. The support line is only open M-F.  according to one site, it is because they have to pay a license fee if you use the ATSC tuner.While the license issue may be the reason, and that's OK, but I'm finding that if you want to get a code for OTA the texting does NOT work, the email has not worked and the phone lines are only M-F and seems to ALYWAYS BE BUSY.  The customer support sucks.  My advice is unless your time and frustration is worth a few $$, SKIP THIS BRAND UNTIL THEY CAN FIX THERE SUPPORT.  The other joke is the support site.  Just click on the "Contact Us" link, it leads to a page that says "Site is Unavailable"  Perfect.I will not buy one of these again.Mine is going to be returned.

Reviews.Title: No issues - nice picture Ok sound
Reviews.Author: SteveD
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid ($170) this TV was an excellent bargain.  It's not a samsung but for a 2nd TV in my kitchen it's exactly what I needed.  semi name brand 32" LED TV for under $200 is a good deal IMO.I have 2 Westinghouse 42" LCD TV's as my daily living room and bedroom units for almost 5 years now still running strong with no issues so this brand has proved itself to be good to me.Mounted it on a articulating arm wall bracket with no issues.  I could not believe how little this TV weighs,  it's super light which is great if your hanging on a wall with not much support or having to carry it around for presentations.Easy set up,  nice remote,  good picture.  Sound is Ok per most Flat screens but works fine for my kitchen.Additional comments added on April 22nd 2013:  The TV picture is still great but there seems to be a problem with the sound where the TV sound will just turn off randomly.  The issue started shortly afer I got it and I would say it happens about once every hour or two where hte sound goes off almost like you hit the mute button.  The TV needs to be turned off and back ion for the sound to reset and be back on.  I may look into see if this is a known issue and a warranty repair is warrented if I can fined he time.

Reviews.Title: Defect Item
Reviews.Author: Lindsey Frith
Reviews.Content: TV had a red line down the end of the screen. I was very disappointed as this was supposed to be a Christmas present. I will be returning and looking elsewhere for a new one.

Reviews.Title: Three stars since so inexpensive, but you get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: DR. B
Reviews.Content: Until I saw this TV I didn't know Westinghouse made TVs and technicaly they don't.  This TV is a product of Westinghouse Digital LLC under license to Westinghouse.  The Westinghouse Digital website seems to imply without actually saying it that this TV is an economical/budget TV, and it is.  The TV is manufactured in China.We got this for a second smaller bedroom.Setup:The TV is protected by a film, like all others, but when you pull off the film on the bottom plastic around the screen two things happen.  First is it tears so you can only get a little piece off at a time but more important, second, the plastic trim pulls loose from the TV itself so you have to be very careful.  The base is also covered by a film, I only mention this because it really show fingerprints.There is NO printed manual, only a DVD.  At first we didn't think much of this but after not being able to find where to plug in the AC adaptor (I admit this is the first TV I have had were you plug the electric cord into an adaptor and the adaptor into the TV, like you do for a printer).  We found why this DVD only manual is a problem.  You have to go to another room and view the DVD on another TV or in our case a computer.  Then one person reads the manual in one room and shouts to the other what to do in the room with the TV.  There are a few mistakes in the manual, e.g., "use four screws to secure the base to the TV", however there are only two holes to do so and only two screws supplied, the AC/DC adaptor input connection instructions refer to numbers that are not in the manual drawings, ditto for where the inputs are.TV set-up includes the now usual:  language, time zone and input (and that's all).  A menu option will get you to adjust the picture, audio and son on.Picture:I am comparing this TV to a Samsung Plasma, which of course cost about 10 times as much so not fair and a Panasonic LCD mid-priced TV.  I'm not a techno-geek so don't measure lumins, hue/saturation, etc. (and to be honest no geek would probably buy this TV), I just adjust the picture to what I like. When you turn on the TV there is a noticeable lag before the picture comes on, longer than our plasma, this takes getting used to.  The picture isn't bad but the first thing I noticed is the picture doesn't seem to "pop" like the other TVs, it is kind of flat.  Also not nearly as sharp as other TVs, just doesn't have the razor sharpness you are used to.  The colors are fairly rich and balanced. So far there isn't any blurring or atrifacts.  Sound is OK for a bedroom, again no one interested in serious sound would buy this TV.One thing I did notice, if you are close to the TV you can see the pixels.  I realize I'd never watch TV that close, I'm taking about 2 feet away while walking past and you just don't see that in the other TVs any more.Summary:This TV is an very inexpensive budget TV and if you are realistic about what you are getting it should work for you.  However, if you are used to a upper level TV you will be disappointed in the picture.  Good TV for a second bedroom, but not really for your main viewing or even a master bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Janice K. Rakes
Reviews.Content: This was bought as a gift and is loved! Great TV at a great price. Would definitely buy this brand again!

Reviews.Title: Light Leakage/Bleed Problem
Reviews.Author: P. Bowman
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV prior to Christmas. Overall picture is very good - bright, sharp, and clear. However, the TV suffers terribly from light leakage/bleed - especially at the top and bottom of the screen. I tried to work with Westinghouse to get the TV serviced or replaced. I called and emailed them several times over two weeks and never received any response to my emails/phone messages. I have finally given up and returned the TV. If I could have gotten some type of customer service from Westinghouse I might have kept the TV. But their customer service response is zero. Amazing that a company this large would have no customer support. I own another Westinghouse TV and have been very happy with it. But after this poor service response, I doubt I'll buy this brand again.

Reviews.Title: Good and cheap
Reviews.Author: gm2008
Reviews.Content: Bought for a Christmas gift and so far have not heard of any difficulty with the TV, easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Fast delivery, Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: MIA "andraty35"
Reviews.Content: I will recommend this to anybody that wants good quality and great price, my dad loved his gift and we didn't spend a lot!

Reviews.Title: LED Blead - had to replace, Second TV Better
Reviews.Author: JLS
Reviews.Content: The first TV I received had white in corners and right side. I returned and got a second TV. This one is better, but not 100%. The lightweight TV is what we needed for the bedroom. I wasn't too terribly concerned with amazing quality. The price was incredible and light weight made it easy to hang on the wall.It works alright for us so far! Not the greatest but the price was what I was after.

Reviews.Title: Be careful, requires activation codes!
Reviews.Author: John McGowen "New Tech"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this t.v. for my grandmother and during setup the t.v. asks for a setup code to activate the tuner.  It gives a web address but I didn't have a computer to use at her house, it gives a number to which you can text the word turner but instead I got an error, it gives a phone number that I called and after waiting 18 minutes I finally spoke with someone who was able to provide me with the analog antenna code and he offered me the digital code as well.  Now first of all I think this is ridiculous to begin with but my fear is that if there is a power outage or any other problem and I'm required to enter this code a year or two in the future and I can no longer find it, how difficult will it be to find it then when it's so difficult to find now and when Westinghouse has all but forgotten about the garbage they pawned off on their customers.  I've decided to box it up and return it so I'm not stuck with a useless tv asking for a code in just a short while.

Reviews.Title: Horrible customer service, poor product!
Reviews.Author: Rita Moore
Reviews.Content: If it says Westinghouse, don't do it!!  TV lasted 8 months, lost picture, then company is impossible to contact.  Still no satisfaction....gave up!  Out $300, still no tv, and nobody cares!  Never will I ever buy another Westinghouse product!

Reviews.Title: Tuner Requires Activation Code from Support
Reviews.Author: Gadgets
Reviews.Content: In order to use the ATSC Tuner you are required to obtain a code directly from Westinghouse to enter into the TV's setup screen. The support website says you can enter your serial number to get your code except that there is no place to enter your serial number. There is a text option that replies back that this option is not currently supported. The 800 line tells you to use the website or send an email. I was told that I would get an immediate response from the email and still do not have a code.Westinghouse's customer service reps were very pleasant but they had no way to help me.  I have a new tv that I can't use.

Reviews.Title: Not good.
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: I have had it about a month and there is already a bright red line on the side of the tv. Stay away from Westinghouse TVs.

Reviews.Title: Lost display within 31 days
Reviews.Author: Nancy Marvin
Reviews.Content: I know there are times that things go wrong within the first month of purchase but Westinghouse customer service is the worst. It took 2 weeks before I was able get a hold of a customer service rep who set me up for returning the TV under the manufacturing warranty. I returned the TV. 25 days later I finally reached a customer service rep at Westinghouse who assured me they found my TV and was placing the order to send the replacement. The next day I called and the order had not been placed and had to phone 3 times (each wait was over 10 min). Each time the customer service rep disconnected the line. (And I was being nice!). I still have no assurances that a replacement will be sent out.

Reviews.Title: Great TV expecially for the price
Reviews.Author: Jason Anderson
Reviews.Content: I am currently living in a barracks room with limited space. This TV is the perfect size. Not to big for the room but not to small were you can't see anything. Also the price was better then any store near by. It took 9 days to get here for my FPO AP address which I personally think is fast. Great TV worth the price and wait.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: jason williams
Reviews.Content: tv in great conditiin and i will order more but didnt like that they delivered and just left at front door with ringing the bell ...could have been stolen

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: M. Maldonado
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom she likes it very much. Quality and audio is good for the price. Good picture on HD channels.

Reviews.Title: Excellent price for a good item
Reviews.Author: Jose "Jose"
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the price!  You need a screwdriver, however, to install the TV on the base.  That could be improved by using a snap-in base.  Other than that, great!

Reviews.Title: Okay picture, horrible sound
Reviews.Author: Erick
Reviews.Content: Light bleed at the bottom.  Internal speakers are horrible, can't get the TV to output to external speakers.  Not all menu options work to help with setup.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good value for money
Reviews.Author: Ashok
Reviews.Content: Thinner and better than heavily advertized brands like LG. I bought couple of them for each room in my house. Customer service is also excellent. I had some minor issue, which got resolved on its own, but the customer service kept returning my call for the next two months.One bonus was that it also works on PAL system through A/V port which is prevelant in Europe/India, though it does not say anywhere in the manual. Added advantage is voltage supply  of 100-240 v and the adapter is outside the TV, easily replacable with a standard laptop adapter. I sent one to India and it works there like a charm, whereas I had trouble using LG there and had to buy a converter.

Reviews.Title: working like a champion
Reviews.Author: eight08trapps
Reviews.Content: bought this tv on black Friday and so far tv has exceeded expectations. i initially thought this tv would be alot worse than it is but so far so good especially with the size and how light it is.

Reviews.Title: Nice & Slim.
Reviews.Author: krantawi
Reviews.Content: Bought this 32-Inch TV for my kids room and they are very happy with it.I'm not much with Westinghouse products, but the price was encouraging.

Reviews.Title: A complete waste of money
Reviews.Author: Shoppa Gal
Reviews.Content: Too much light showing from behind screen. Its distraction and distorts any dark images on the screen.  I put it my 2 year-old's playroom because she doesn't care about picture quality. So not worth It.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Teri Newton
Reviews.Content: The tv was great and a great price. BUT what I didn`t like is that it needed a code to get it to work. Well it took 3 days to great an e-mail back after I sent them one to even get code to start using the tv.

Reviews.Title: Great picture/Poor sound!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Bonkers "Dr. Bonkers"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this LED TV because it was the best picture quality I saw in Best Buy and Target in its price range. The contrast ratio, solid black levels, and absence of motion blur are great.What I did not realize when I test drove this unit though was that the sound was AM radio tinny. It has a really marked mid range honk combined with a lack of bass compared to my Insignia TV (check my reviews for model).When Amazon delivered this unit, I was very excited and mounted it in my kitchen so that my wife could watch TV in there if she wanted to. The picture quality was as good as I remembered it, being fed via Verizon cable box and Amazon Basics HDMI cable. There is some light bleed around the back, but it is really not that bad compared to other units in the same price range that had no light bleed but porrer picture quality and motion smearing.The sound quality was shockingly poor, like a flashback to Philco TV's from the 70's. In this day and age, with the level of maturity that most engineers/designers have in making speakers sound great in flat panel TV's, I was shocked that this level of quality would be put on the market for sound quality. I guess they had to cut a corner somewhere for budget.If you are a non-critical listener and just care about visuals or are using surround receiver to handle audio, I would recommend this display in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: picture and sound are very good. we hung it on the wall in bedroom and enjoy watching tv before going to sleep. works very well for this.

Reviews.Title: Run from this one!
Reviews.Author: D. Kerrigan "Dan"
Reviews.Content: TV bought as a gift and was only turned on a dozen times or so over a 4 week period.  Was told sound would go up and down on its own.  Then the sound dissapeared while watching tv, we thought it was the particular channel but we were wrong.  Immediately returned.  When i brought back the tv, the lady doing returns knew why i was returning the tv before i told her, she warned to stay away from this brand of tv's as they are getting nothing but returns.

Reviews.Title: Great price and screen quality - minor annoyances
Reviews.Author: Jim O'Connell
Reviews.Content: The price and quality of this Westinghouse 32-inch greatly exceed any issues.  Easy setup, light and sturdy.The only annoyances are there is it takes three seconds for the power light to turn on, a couple of seconds after the power light for the display to even light up with the Westinghouse logo.  There also is no power button on the monitor so you have to find the remote to turn it off.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Ron Dryer
Reviews.Content: This product far surpassed our expectations. An excellent value for the money...A little side story...the item was not available to ship to Puerto Rico, so I had it sent to my sister in Atlanta, who then mailed it to me in PR via USPS. Somewhere along the way, it got side tracked (kind of lost) and I had to have the Post Office trace it twice. They finally found it, but when I picked it up, the box was practically destroyed, with puncture holes and the whole front smashed in. I didn't give it much hope. But I have to credit the Chinese, or whomever packed this TV, because there wasn't a mark on it. I couldn't believe it. I plugged it in and it worked perfectly with a great picture. I'm not a TV fanatic, and don't know a lot about pixels, but it looks as good as my 42" flatscreen. Glad we got this one!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the right price
Reviews.Author: Emily Dekelly
Reviews.Content: I got this for $187 and I think this TV is right around $200. I think paying $250 for this TV is too much compared to what else is on the market. That being said here are the pros and cons.Pro:-Great viewing angles-I can see it clear from low, high, left and right which is what I find cheaper TVs lack most-The HD picture is fine. Not the most amazing ever but still can watch a nice movie on it. I don't see you able to tell too much different, except maybe from the nicest TVs on the market.-Size-I don't have a huge room and, as most people said, a bedroom with this is about right. It may be undersized in most living rooms now, but great for a bedroom-slim-It is much slimmer than many budget TVs I see. It looks fairly good too, thinner edge from end of screen to border, kind of a wavy black front trim which looks neat too.Cons:-Takes about 5 seconds to turn on. Doesn't bother me though, it has a red light which comes on before the picture so you know it is going.-Standard definition is not very good. My old tube TV had a better picture on regular TV. I think this is more that I have a bad signal compounded by a cheap VCR causing this. Sound is fine and the images don't blur. There is almost film noise on the screen this way. Noticed no problem if I use the HD input though.I would buy this again. For the price it is totally worth it. I have had it a little under a month so can't comment on durability. And lastly the light bleed many complain about was nothing to me. I think this varies more TV to TV. Mine has only the littlest on the edges, almost evenly. It is nothing worse than many TVs I see.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with a great price
Reviews.Author: dantheman
Reviews.Content: This product is MORE THAN i expected.  Color are so real compared with LG or Sony.  Westinghouse should get recognition out there in the TV market.

Reviews.Title: omg
Reviews.Author: katyjo "katyjo"
Reviews.Content: once my grand son opened this he was missing for the entire day playing his videos and having a ball.

Reviews.Title: Speedy Shipment
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: This TV came prior to the delivery date with free shipping. I found the set up to be easy and the product serves its purpose.The TV picture seems somewhat dull and doesnt have the sharp bright images that I have seen with other brands. I currently own Toshiba, Vizio, and LG' televisions in other rooms of my house of which have crisp clear images. I have tried to adjust the color, sharpness, brightness using the set up menu although no success. Luckily for me, this TV is in my guest room bedroom, so I won't have to watch it often.

Reviews.Title: USB no so good
Reviews.Author: elmanpa
Reviews.Content: The TV is very good, but the port USB no so good. and protrude light for down and up. The rest of TV is very good.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift.
Reviews.Author: tactlc
Reviews.Content: My mom really loved her Christmas gift. The order was here quickly and just as described. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Christmas present
Reviews.Author: heather
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my daughter for christmas.  The item came just as described and in a very timely manner.  She enjoys this television every day.

Reviews.Title: Agree with other reviewers
Reviews.Author: Donald A. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Great price (I got for $200 on Amazon).  The light bleed is the worst of any monitor or screen I've ever seen.  However with a tight budget, that's acceptable..

Reviews.Title: Great Deal.!
Reviews.Author: Pedro Perez De Moya
Reviews.Content: It was really a steal..!! The TV has great resolution, I have not find another 32 LED TV with a price like this.

Reviews.Title: As expected
Reviews.Author: Tom The Man
Reviews.Content: The tv was clear, slim, and works fine. It is exactly as advertised. We are happy with it, and expect no problems.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: dirtydan
Reviews.Content: Great TV for spare bedroom picture is not as clear as 1080 but works great.  Price was graet and would order again

Reviews.Title: Manufacturer sucks!
Reviews.Author: kamaugrandma
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased this TV on Nov 24 and had to send it back because the black at the bottom of the screen had a white shadow of some sort in it. I did replace it with another one today which seems to be better but I cannot get an ATSC access code from the Manufacturer.  I was on hold for almost 45 min, only to finally get answering service who told me to email the Mfg.  I should get an answer within 48 hrs!! Amazon customer service tried the Mfg and was also on hold for an extended period of time.  All I can say is-I'm not throwing away the box!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: jesoli
Reviews.Content: AlphaI'm truly disappointed. I have received the equipment however it would not start because the power supply came damaged. I had to buy a power supply to test it and turn on the tv. It cost me around $75. I really do not understand how this could get bad. They should be more careful with these teams and ensure their quality.

Reviews.Title: missing parts and poorly made
Reviews.Author: Shaundra L. Horras
Reviews.Content: When I got this t.v. it was missing part of the cord to plug it in with. I called amazon and they were willing to ship me a new t.v. which was great but after feeling how poorly made this product was and then doing more research on the company and the t.v. itself I opted to send it back for a refund. I have no idea how the picture quality is since I was never able to turn it on. But trying to get a hold of Westinghouse was uneventful even amazon customer support couldn't get a hold of them. The t.v. is low priced but it is also low quality.

Reviews.Title: LED TV
Reviews.Author: David M Meyer
Reviews.Content: I like this product because I was able to mount it on my daughter's wall. I also loved the price!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Buster Darr
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for our bedroom. Plenty of input options, good picture, and decent sound. Would I purchase this for gaming or as our primary television in our home? Probably not. But, for under $200, it does everything I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: A lot of value
Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: My son has been using this TV for the past year for the Xbox 360.  He has nothing but praise for it and he is very picky when it comes to electronics.  It has been 100 percent reliable.  The colors are good and there is no blurring with the action.  It is sleek and energy efficient.  The remote is easy to use.  Probably the major weakness is that the sound quality is only average.  Last night my wife and I watched Netflix movies on it as my daughter's birthday party had taken over our living room.  I was impressed by the picture quality.  If you compare this TV to units costing much more you will notice a qualitative difference, especially in sound quality, but not by much considering the price difference.  The LEDs have lasted a year so I would think they are going to last their full potential of 30K hours since they have not been defective thus far.  LEDs are also more energy efficient so if you are off grid or have alternative energy this may be a consideration in your purchase.

Reviews.Title: Decent 2nd or 3rd TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased for a home office and video game console. Overall the TV performs fine and at @ $179 was worth the price. As one other person noted, there is some noticeable light bleed. On my particular unit the light bleed is at the bottom of the screen in 2 places. The light bleed is not noticeable when anything other than black is projected. I could not see the defect when watching a show or playing a video game other than when in transition between scenes.The only other complaint I have is that I am unable to find a code to work with my Directv remote. Searching the web others have posted the same issue. I am satisfied with this TV at the sale price. If I had paid more the tv would probably be exchanged due to the light bleedAesthetically the set is very nice. It is very thin and light. It should be easy to mount to most any surface. The sound is just ok, but I didn't expect much in a tv within this price range. There are only 2 HDMI ports. Sine I will use a game console to play DVD's this should be ok.

Reviews.Title: Extremely satisfied!
Reviews.Author: John Michael Lerma
Reviews.Content: Purchased on Black Friday 2012 for a great price.  Unpacked and found easy to assemble to its base.  Set up was a breeze and comes with a DVD instructional.  Have been watching regular television, DVDs through our Home Theater, movie from In-Demand, and listening to music through Music Choice.  This television is perfect for our brown stone apartment.  Beautiful color and contrast, great viewing from the side.  I couldn't be happier with a purchase and especially a new television during this economy.  I recommend it after a couple months usage because it has been working perfectly for me.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Michel Laemers
Reviews.Content: Foe a 32 inch LCD this set looks good had a good user interface and a great price of $219.00. I was a little skeptical seeing the old Westinghouse brand knowing some Asian company only bought the naming rights to this old line American Company.

Reviews.Title: Work Out Room TV
Reviews.Author: Jim Bourisaw
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cost effective TV for the work out room.  This fit the bill, easy to mount on the wall and no problems so far.  I would recommend this TV for someone looking for a small TV in a Kitchen, work out room, closet etc...

Reviews.Title: Affordable Television with Minor Drawbacks
Reviews.Author: R. Hall
Reviews.Content: I received this television set as a Christmas gift. It was an upgrade for our family and it replaced an old, clunky tube television that we had prior to this one. This is a budget television and that is reflected in the average picture quality. That being said, for the price of this television this is a great deal. This television would be great for a spare bedroom, but depending on how often you plan on using the television, you may want to consider investing in a higher quality television.The physical installation of the TV was quick and painless. It can easily be assembled with only one person. The installation requires two screws and I was impressed at how safe and sturdy the television felt after being installed on to the included television stand. The television takes about four seconds to power on (which was concerning at first). I subtracted one star for the initial programming and set-up of the television. In order to scan channels it requires you to provide an activation code that must be collected from the manufacturer. There are several options given for obtaining this code (phone, web, or text). The text option did not work and I would expect that a brand-name television would have simple affairs like this in order. Additionally, if you plan to activate over the phone, you must call during business hours. After the inconvenience of going two routes unsuccessfully, I was able to find the activation code by going to the website. A word of wisdom for owners of this television, don't bother calling or trying to get the activation code by text. Go straight to the Westinghouse website and follow the instructions included with the television.After inputting the activation code, the television took 10 minutes to scan and auto-program our channels. Picture quality was average, but most buyers should know this going in. It is a huge step up if you are coming from an old tube-television, but those who really notice small details in television picture quality may be disappointed. There is a large amount of light bleed at the bottom and top of the picture that is noticeable when there are dark colors on the screen. While it isn't distracting for our family, I can understand how it may be distracting for others. The overall quality of the picture is good and we have been able to enjoy Blu-Ray quality movies and High Definition television.The four-star rating of this television is because of the value factor. For the price being paid, you are getting a good and working product that will be suitable for many individuals and families. If you are really into television quality, plan on hosting Super-Bowl parties, or are really particular about television quality, I would recommend exploring other television options. For every-day use, this does a good job and we are happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal at Menards
Reviews.Author: ssmith
Reviews.Content: I just got one of these at Menards for 127 bucks!  I have to send in the $60 rebate, but what a deal!

ProductInfo.Features:
Lightweight means a lower transportation carbon footprint.
Dynamic 100,000:1 contrast ratio
This product has earned the Energy Star and meets Federal energy efficiency standards.
ProductInfo.Name: Westinghouse EW32S5UW 32-Inch 720p 60Hz Slim LED HDTV (Black)
